title.narrative: Are You on the right track

description.narrative:
STOP AIDS NOW !, Oxfam Novib and other Dutch organizations have initiated a process of strengthening the capacity of non-governmental organizations in 12 countries (Mali, South Africa, Senegal, Ethiopia, Ghana, Kenya, Malawi, Nigeria, Senegal, Swaziland, Tanzania, Uganda, Zambia, Zimbabwe) on the effective intervention based on evidence and rights. Such action includes any activity initiatedfor youth in the areas of SRDS, education and prevention and fight against HIV / AIDS The process is based on two major tools whoseapplication helps to establish a practice of effective intervention planning tool "Are you on good track in french -Etes vous surla bonne voie - Six Steps to measure the effects and impacts of development projects."
1. Objectives of the process Ensure the availability of expertise in 12 countries through training of trainers Promoting effective interventions in the areas of sexual and reproductive health (SRH) education and prevention of HIV / AIDS for youth
2. STEPS IN THE PROCESS
Step 1: The theory of planned behavior (includes sub-behaviors, determinants and connects program activities). Step 2: The characteristics of effective interventions (using the planning and support) Step 3:RGES (critical themes, gender inequality, the needs of young people living with HIV or YPLHIV) Step 4: Evaluation of the effects and impacts of program activities (using the manual Are you on track? ) For Mali, Oxfam Novib support the action plan to promote AADeC tool with two external partners: NGO TONUS and Jeunesses et developpement Specifically support will be directed to the Partners My Right, My Voice: One World and its partners in implementation as well as the EFA coalition The objective is to see that quality indicators on behavior change with youth groups involved in the program with Sexual Reproductive Health

participating-org.narrative: Association d'appui a l'auto Developpement communautaire

The Association for Supporting Community Self-Development (AADeC) is a Malinese organisation founded in September 1991 by a group of men and women who wanted to rectify development problems and contribute to building a just and democratic society. AADeC#s missionis to promote the self-development of deprived rural and urban communities by supporting their initiatives in the areas of education, micro-entrepreneurship and health. Special attention is paid to gender roles. The community plays an importantrole in the design,implementation and continuation of the work. The community presents initiatives, which AADeC takes further by providing support. AADeC#s schools are run by parent development committees. These were established by AADeC.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to basic social services
